keyMoments.title: Drim's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: A mysterious young boy named Drim appears at night with a seahorse instrument, approaching the Going Merry while the crew sleeps.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the antagonists of the Ocean's Dream Arc who will steal the Straw Hats' memories.

keyMoments.title: Drim Observes the Chaos
keyMoments.description: Drim watches from a distance as the crew struggles with their lost memories and begins to split apart.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Drim is monitoring the effects of the memory theft, though his true motivations remain unclear.

relationships.description: Drim is under Noko's hypnotic control, serving as the seahorse's agent and decoy to steal memories from victims.

evolutionMoments.description: Drim appears with Noko and uses the seahorse's power to steal the Straw Hats' memories.

reveals.information: Drim is being controlled by Noko the seahorse and has no powers of his own
While hypnotized, Drim displays devious and cunning behavior, approaching victims in a friendly manner

keyMoments.title: Noko's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: A seahorse-shaped creature appears in the ocean at night, being played like an instrument by Drim to create hypnotic music.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the main antagonist of the Ocean's Dream Arc and the source of the memory-stealing power.

keyMoments.title: Memory Stealing Power Revealed
keyMoments.description: Noko uses hypnotic music to steal the memories of all sleeping Straw Hat crew members, causing them to forget everything up to the point before they joined the crew.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Noko's unique and powerful memory-stealing ability that drives the entire arc's conflict.

abilities.description: Noko can play a mournful sound that allows him to extract memories from sleeping individuals within earshot. The victims lose all memories up to a certain point in their past.
By making eye contact, Noko can control others' actions. He uses this power to control Drim and force him to help steal memories.

relationships.description: Noko controls the young boy Drim through hypnosis, using him as an agent to help steal memories from island inhabitants and travelers.

evolutionMoments.description: Noko uses Drim to approach the Straw Hats and steal their memories while they sleep.

reveals.information: Noko can steal memories through hypnotic music played while victims are sleeping
Noko can hypnotize others through eye contact to control their actions
Noko is a sentient creature with goals and motivations beyond simple animal behavior

keyMoments.title: Robin Stays Awake
keyMoments.description: Robin is awake reading late at night, making her the only crew member unaffected by Noko's memory-stealing attack.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Robin as the only one who remembers their adventures and must try to keep the crew together.

keyMoments.title: Robin Tries to Explain
keyMoments.description: Robin attempts to convince the confused crew that they are all nakama on the Going Merry, but struggles because she joined most recently and has limited knowledge of their pasts.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Robin's position as the newest crew member and her commitment to keeping the Straw Hats together.
keyMoments.quote: You're all part of the Straw Hat Pirates. This is our ship, the Going Merry.

keyMoments.title: Robin's Failed Attempt to Keep the Crew Together
keyMoments.description: Despite her best efforts, Robin is unable to prevent the crew from splitting apart as Nami and Zoro leave and others remain confused and distrustful.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's growth as a crew member and her dedication to the Straw Hats, while also showing the difficulty of her unique situation.

reveals.information: Robin shows her deep commitment to the Straw Hat crew by desperately trying to keep them together, demonstrating her growth from a loner to a devoted nakama

keyMoments.title: Nami Reverts to Pirate-Hating Thief
keyMoments.description: Having lost all memories of joining the crew, Nami reverts to her pre-Arlong Park personality as a cat burglar who hates pirates and doesn't trust anyone.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how much Nami has changed since joining the crew by contrasting her current self with her past distrustful, pirate-hating persona.
keyMoments.quote: I'm a thief who steals from pirates. Why would I be working with pirates?

keyMoments.title: Nami Steals Treasure and Flees
keyMoments.description: True to her thief nature, Nami steals treasure from the Going Merry and escapes using a waver, heading toward a nearby island.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Nami's reversion to her lone wolf persona and creates the first major split in the memory-less crew.

reveals.information: Memory loss shows how much Nami has grown by reverting her to her distrustful, calculating, pirate-hating self from before Arlong Park

keyMoments.title: Zoro Departs by Swimming
keyMoments.description: Having reverted to his bounty hunter persona, Zoro decides to leave the ship by simply diving into the ocean and swimming away toward a nearby island.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's independent nature and his pre-crew mentality of working alone as a bounty hunter.

reveals.information: Memory loss reveals Zoro's independent, solitary nature from his bounty hunter days before joining the crew
